They are not pointed but rather rounded at the tips, which is typical for this breed. The size of the ears is substantial compared to the head, adding to the characteristic look of an Old English Sheepdog. There are no visible unique markings or spots on the ears; they are primarily a mix of white and darker fur, blending seamlessly into the rest of the coat. The ears' shape and size contribute significantly to the dog's overall appearance, making them a defining feature of the breed.
